\'\'[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]\'\' Magazine announced the weekend before the release of \'\'[[Halloween II (2009 film)|Halloween II]]\'\' that Zombie would be directing a remake of the 1950s film \'\'[[The Blob]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/rob-zombie-to-remake-the-blob/| title=Zombie Remakes `The Blob\'|author=Mike Fleming|date=August 27, 2009| accessdate=2015-03-04| work=Variety}}</ref> Zombie later chose to back out of the film as he "didn\'t want to do another remake".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.empireonline.com/news/story.asp?NID=30225 |title=Rob Zombie Talks Lords of Salem &#124; Movie News &#124; Empire |work=Empire |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Zombie was the executive producer of the animated film \'\'[[The Haunted World of El Superbeasto]]\'\', based upon his comic book series \'\'The Adventures of El Superbeasto\'\'. The series previously appeared in his \'\'Spookshow International\'\' comic book. The film was released in limited showings at selected theaters on September 12, 2009, and to DVD on September 22, 2009. It features the voices of [[Tom Papa]], [[Paul Giamatti]], Zombie\'s wife [[Sheri Moon Zombie]], and [[Rosario Dawson]].<ref>{{IMDb title|419724|The Haunted World of El Superbeasto}}</ref>

===2010\xe2\x80\x9313: Move to Roadrunner, \'\'Hellbilly Deluxe 2\'\' and \'\'Venomous Rat Regeneration Vendor\'\'===
It was announced in 2009 that Zombie had begun working on his fourth studio album, the follow up to his 2006 album \'\'[[Educated Horses]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blistering.com/fastpage/fpengine.php/link/1/templateid/25735/tempidx/1/menuid/1 |title=Blistering Metal News: ROB ZOMBIE To Begin Work On New Studio Album In June |publisher=Blistering.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=107825&utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+blabbermouth+%28Blabbermouth.net%27s+Daily+Headlines%29 |title=ROB ZOMBIE Talks \'Tyrannosaurus Rex\': \'I Haven\'t Even Written The Script Yet\' |publisher=Blabbermouth.Net |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=comments policy &nbsp;8&nbsp;&nbsp;comments posted |url=http://www.ultimate-guitar.com/news/upcoming_releases/rob_zombie_says_new_album_is_a_great_follow-up_to_original_hellbilly_deluxe.html |title=Rob Zombie Says New Album Is \'A Great Follow-Up\' To Original \'Hellbilly Deluxe\' &#124; News @ |publisher=Ultimate-guitar.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Before the album\'s release, it was confirmed that Zombie had parted ways with [[Geffen Records]], and had signed a new deal with [[Roadrunner Records]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hardtimes.ca/node/9274 |title=Rob Zombie (NY) Leaves Geffen Records, Signs With Roadrunner/Loud & Proud |publisher=Hardtimes.Ca |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> On the split, Zombie stated "I was really loving the album, and I was very nervous about Geffen because over the years they\'ve sort of just, you know, morphed into a different label [...] They\'ve gone from being like the premiere hard rock label, back in the day that I signed to, to something else. It just didn\'t feel good to me, and I thought, like, \'I\'ve got to get off this label.\' You know, we pulled the release date obviously and I was like, you know, no matter what it takes, it\'s worth it, let\'s just find a new label, \'cause this just isn\'t working for me anymore."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eddietrunk.com/index.cfm/pk/view/cd/naa/cdid/417186/pid/400512 |title=Rob Zombie Says He Left Geffen Records Because They "Morphed Into A Different Label" &#124; Rock News &#124; Eddie Trunk |publisher=EddieTrunk.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Zombie later confirmed the title of his new album to be \'\'[[Hellbilly Deluxe 2|Hellbilly Deluxe 2: Noble Jackals, Penny Dreadfuls and the Systematic Dehumanization of Cool]]\'\'. He later explained that the album was titled as a sequel to his 1998 debut because they sounded similar in both "vibe" and "attitude".<ref>{{cite web|last=Records |first=Roadrunner |url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/news/video-interview-rob-zombie-on-hellbilly-deluxe-2 |title=Video Interview: Rob Zombie on Hellbilly Deluxe 2 |publisher=Roadrunner Records |date=2011-07-12 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> The album was released on February 2, 2010. \'\'Hellbilly Deluxe 2\'\' received average or mixed reviews from critics. On [[Metacritic]], the album earned a score of 63/100 based on ten reviews.<ref>{{cite web| title = Reviews of \'\'Hellbilly Deluxe 2\'\'| publisher = [[Metacritic]]| url = http://www.metacritic.com/music/hellbilly-deluxe-ii| accessdate = February 10, 2010}}</ref> The album debuted at No. 8 on the [[Billboard 200|\'\'Billboard\'\' 200]] chart, selling 49,000 copies in its first week of release.<ref>{{cite web|last=Records |first=Roadrunner |url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/news/rob-zombie-s-hellbilly-deluxe-2-debuts-at-8-on-billboard |title=Rob Zombie\'s \'HellBilly Deluxe 2\' Debuts at No. 8 on Billboard |publisher=Roadrunner Records |date=2011-07-12 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=rob zombie|chart=all}} |title=Hellbilly Deluxe, Vol. 2 \xe2\x80\x93 Rob Zombie |work=Billboard |date=2010-02-20 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> A special edition of the album was released on September 28, 2010 featuring three new songs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=143552 |title=ROB ZOMBIE: \'Mars Needs Women\' Video Released; \'Hellbilly Deluxe 2\' Special Edition Detailed |publisher=Blabbermouth.Net |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref>

[[File:20140615-132-Nova Rock 2014-Rob Zombie-Rob Zombie.JPG|thumb|Rob Zombie at [[Nova Rock Festival|Nova Rock]] 2014]]
In 2011, Zombie confirmed that he was working on a new film. The horror film, \'\'[[The Lords of Salem (film)|The Lords of Salem]]\'\', gets its title from a song off of Zombie\'s third studio album, \'\'[[Educated Horses]]\'\'. It is about the city of [[Salem, Massachusetts]] being visited by a coven of ancient witches. The film started shooting on October 17, 2011.<ref>[http://famousmonstersoffilmland.com/2011/10/17/the-lords-of-salem-starts-shooting/ The Lords of Salem start shooting]{{dead link|date=November 2012}}</ref> The trailer debuted at Zombie\'s concert on May 11, 2012, at the [[PNC Bank Arts Center]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Barton|first=Steve|title=Rob Zombie Bewitched by \xe2\x80\x98Lords of Salem\xe2\x80\x99|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/55547/take-shaky-peek-trailer-rob-zombies-lords-salem/|publisher=Dread Central}}</ref> In an interview Zombie said that the film would be his cinematically biggest film and described it as "if [[Ken Russell]] directed \'\'[[The Shining (film)|The Shining]]\'\'".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=B2cv_UGnV98#! |title=Rob Zombie Goes Big with the Lords Of Salem |publisher=YouTube |date=2012-06-13 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> \'\'The Lords of Salem\'\' became the last film of veteran actor [[Richard Lynch (actor)|Richard Lynch]], who died in 2012.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2012/06/20/halloween-battlestar-galactica-actor-richard-lynch-dies-at-76/ |title=\'Halloween,\' \'Battlestar Galactica\' actor Richard Lynch dies at 76 |publisher=Fox News |date= June 20, 2012|accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/21/richard-lynch-dead-bad-dr_n_1614848.html |title=Richard Lynch Dead: \'Bad Dreams\' Villain Dies At 76 |work=Huffington Post |date= June 21, 2012|accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.geeksofdoom.com/2012/06/19/actor-richard-lynch-dies-at-age-76/ |title=Confirmed: Actor Richard Lynch Dies At Age 76 |publisher=Geeks of Doom |date=2012-06-19 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> \'\'The Lords of Salem\'\' screened at the 2012 [[Toronto International Film Festival]] before being released in the United States in April 2013. In 2012, it was revealed that Zombie would also be writing and directing a film titled \'\'The Broad Street Bullies\'\', which would be based on the [[Philadelphia Flyers]] hockey team.<ref>{{cite web|last=Fleming |first=Mike |url=http://www.deadline.com/2012/06/rob-zombie-targets-philadelphia-flyers-hockey-team-for-feature-broad-street-bullies/ |title=Rob Zombie Targets Philadelphia Flyers Hockey Team For \'Broad Street Bullies\' Pic |publisher=Deadline.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/rob-zombie-broad-street-bullies/174327/ |title=Rob Zombie to Write, Direct and Produce BROAD STREET BULLIES Based on the 1970s Philadelphia Flyers |publisher=Collider |date=2012-06-19 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> The film will be Zombie\'s first non-horror film.<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.philly.com/philly/entertainment/Rob-Zombie-to-writedirect-a-Flyers-film-called-Broad-Street-Bullies.html |title=Rob Zombie to write/direct a Flyers film called \'Broad Street Bullies\' |publisher=Philly.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/nhl/story/_/id/8077105/rob-zombie-produce-film-philadelphia-flyers-broad-street-bullies |title=Rob Zombie to produce film about Philadelphia Flyers\' Broad Street Bullies |publisher=ESPN |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Zombie has since stated that the film was in the "research stages", and a release date is unknown.<ref>{{cite web|last=Trask |first=Mike |url=http://espn.go.com/blog/playbook/sounds/post/_/id/2407/zombie-to-make-broad-street-bullies-film |title=Rob Zombie talks Broad Street Bullies film \xe2\x80\x93 Athletes\' Music, Workout Playlists, ESPN Music \xe2\x80\x93 Sounds Blog \xe2\x80\x93 ESPN Playbook |publisher=ESPN |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Zombie later stated that \'\'Tyrannosaurus Rex\'\' would be his next released film after \'\'The Lords of Salem\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/42700/rob-zombie-talks-lords-salem-blob-and-more |title=Rob Zombie Talks Lords of Salem, The Blob, and More! &#124; Horror Movie, DVD, & Book Reviews, News, Interviews at Dread Central |publisher=Dreadcentral.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref>

In July 2012, Zombie confirmed that he was working on his fifth studio album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rttnews.com/1923547/marilyn-manson-and-rob-zombie-announce-joint-u-k-arena-tour.aspx |title=Marilyn Manson And Rob Zombie Announce Joint U.K. Arena Tour |publisher=Rttnews.com |date=2012-07-16 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Recording for the project began in June 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://themusicpress.org/news/marilyn-zombie-tour/ |title=Marilyn Zombie Tour |publisher=The Music Press |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.guitarworld.com/rob-zombie-set-enter-studio-june-record-new-album |title=Rob Zombie Set to Enter Studio in June to Record New Album |publisher=Guitar World |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> "We just want to make a dark, heavy, weird record and stick to that idea [...] If something comes up that isn\'t, we won\'t finish it. We\'ll stick to the plan."<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2012/4/11/rob-zombie-promises-next-studio-album-will-be-a-dark-heavy-w.html |title=Rob Zombie Promises Next Studio Album Will Be a "Dark, Heavy, Record" \xe2\x80\x93 Music News \xe2\x80\x93 ABC News Radio |publisher=Abcnewsradioonline.com |date=2012-04-11 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://q106fm.com/news/articles/2012/apr/11/rob-zombie-promises-next-studio-album-will-be-a-dark-heavy-weird-record/ |title=Rob Zombie Promises Next Studio Album Will Be a "Dark, Heavy, Weird Record" \xe2\x80\x93 Q106 Rock On! |publisher=Q106fm.com |date=2012-04-11 |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref>

From September through December 2012, Rob Zombie toured with [[Marilyn Manson]] in the US and Europe on the [[Twins of Evil Tour]].

On January 30, 2013, Rob Zombie announced that the fifth record would be called \'\'[[Venomous Rat Regeneration Vendor]]\'\'. The lead single from \'\'Venomous Rat Regeneration Vendor\'\' called "[[Dead City Radio and the New Gods of Supertown]]" was released on February 25, 2013. The album was released April 23.

===2014\xe2\x80\x93present: Sixth album===
On April 17, 2014, Zombie told The Pulse of Radio that he had started work on new material for his sixth studio album in January, and plans to resume work on it in May.<ref name="blabbermouth1">{{cite web|url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/rob-zombie-already-at-work-on-sixth-solo-effort/ |title=Rob Zombie Already At Work On Sixth Solo Effort |publisher=Blabbermouth.net |date=2014-04-17 |accessdate=2014-04-17}}</ref>

On July 20, 2014, Zombie ended his set at [[Rock Fest]] after only two songs due to losing his voice.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://loudwire.com/rob-zombie-ends-concert-two-songs-throat-issues/ |title=Rob Zombie Ends Concert After Two Songs Due to Throat Issues |publisher=Loudwire.com |date=2014-07-21 |accessdate=2014-07-25}}</ref>

On September 14, 2014 Rob Zombie once again appeared on The Pulse Of Radio to tell them that he has nearly completed his upcoming sixth solo studio album but also stated that he would be taking a break from touring for a while to concentrate on making his film called 31. He has recently expressed interest in remaking the indy-cult film Rock Bottom Creek.<ref>{{cite web|title=ROB ZOMBIE\'s Next Album Will Be His \'Best Record Yet\'|url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/rob-zombies-next-album-will-be-his-best-record-yet/|publisher=[[Blabbermouth.net]]|date=September 14, 2014}}</ref>

On September 17, 2014 the organizers of the Wacken Open Air Festival in Northern Germany announced that Rob Zombie and his band were scheduled to perform at the 2015 annual Wacken Open Air Festival. Whether his new album will be released and promoted in time for the 2015 edition of the Wacken Open Air Festival is something to be revealed at a later date.[http://www.wacken.com/en/bands/bands-billing/][http://www.wacken.com/en/woa2014/main-bands/billing-20140/]

On January 21, 2015, Rob Zombie announced via Twitter that the final mixes for his as of yet untitled sixth album are finished.<ref>{{cite web|title=Rob Zombie on Twitter: "Just finished the final mixes with @zeuss1 for the new studio album. Best album yet. No joke."|url=https://twitter.com/RobZombie/status/557886159431667712/|publisher=[[Twitter]]|date=January 21, 2015|accessdate=January 22, 2015}}</ref>

Zombie [[Crowdfunding|Crowdfunded]] his old school [[slasher film]] \'\'[[31 (film)|31]]\'\',.<ref>[http://www.fanbacked.com/c/31-rob-zombie-film/ New \xe2\x80\x9931\xe2\x80\xb2 Art As Rob Zombie Relaunches Campaign]</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Rob Zombie 31|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3331947/go-31-location-scouting-rob-zombie/|publisher=[[Twitter]]|date=January 21, 2015|accessdate=January 22, 2015}}</ref>

==Other endeavors==
Aside from his musical and directorial career, Zombie has also taken part in numerous other ventures. He appeared in the 1994 film \'\'[[Airheads]]\'\', along with the rest of his band [[White Zombie (band)|White Zombie]], where they performed their single "[[Feed the Gods]]".<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109068/fullcredits IMDb]</ref> Zombie has also composed music for occasions other than his own albums or soundtracks. He composed the original score for the video game \'\'[[Twisted Metal III]]\'\', released in 1998.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0376282/fullcredits#cast Twisted Metal III (1998) (VG) \xe2\x80\x93 Full cast and crew<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> His music is featured in both Twisted Metal III and IV, and he is a playable character in the fourth game. He also composed the score for the video game \'\'[[Gran Turismo 2]]\'\', released in 1999.<ref>{{IMDb title|0245138}}</ref> His song "Dragula" is one of the tracks in the game. Zombie also directed and wrote a fictitious trailer for the film \'\'[[Werewolf Women of the SS]]\'\',  which was seen in the 2007 film \'\'[[Grindhouse (film)|Grindhouse]]\'\', directed by [[Robert Rodriguez]] and [[Quentin Tarantino]].<ref>{{IMDb title|0462322}}</ref> Zombie even dabbled in the world of commercials, directing a scary spot for [[Woolite]] in 2011.<ref>[http://www.styleite.com/news/rob-zombie-woolite/ "Rob Zombie Directs Terrifyingly Creepy Commercial For Woolite"]</ref>  Before the success of White Zombie, he was also a production assistant for the series \'\'[[Pee-wee\'s Playhouse]]\'\'.<ref>{{IMDb name|0957772}}</ref>

Zombie has also taken part in numerous stints as an actor, mostly with voice-only roles. He has an uncredited role as "Dr. Wolfenstein\'s assistant" in his directorial debut film \'\'[[House of 1000 Corpses]]\'\'.<ref>{{IMDb title|0251736}}</ref> He has provided his voice to animated series \'\'[[Spider-Man: The New Animated Series]]\'\' and \'\'[[Justice League Unlimited]]\'\', portraying Dr. Kurt Connors and Ichthultu, respectively.<ref>{{IMDb title|0618197}}</ref><ref>{{IMDb title|0706892}}</ref> He has a voice-only cameo in the 2006 film \'\'[[Slither (2006 film)|Slither]]\'\' as Dr. Karl,<ref>{{IMDb title|0439815}}</ref> and another voice-only role as God in \'\'[[Super (2010 American film)|Super]]\'\', released in 2010.<ref>{{IMDb title|1512235}}</ref> Zombie has also done work with comic books, having numerous series available. His \'\'Spookshow International\'\' series launched in November 2003, and went on to produce nine editions, with the last coming out in July 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comicvine.com/rob-zombies-spookshow-international/49-18992/ |title=Rob Zombie\'s Spookshow International (MVCreation comic book) \xe2\x80\x93 9 issues |publisher=Comicvine.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> His second series, \'\'The Nail\'\', spawned four issues between June and October 2004, while his \'\'Bigfoot\'\' series lasted from February to May 2005, spawning four issues.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comicvine.com/bigfoot/49-23482/ |title=Bigfoot (IDW Publishing comic book) \xe2\x80\x93 4 issues |publisher=Comicvine.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=The Last American Virgin |url=http://www.comicvine.com/the-nail/49-19281/ |title=The Nail (Dark Horse Comics comic book) \xe2\x80\x93 4 issues |publisher=Comicvine.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> \'\'The Devil\'s Rejects\'\' was a set of comics based after Zombie\'s [[The Devil\'s Rejects|film of the same name]], while \'\'The Haunted World of El Superbeasto\'\' would later be turned into Zombie\'s first animated film.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zombiefaq.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=146&Itemid=78 |title=Comics |publisher=ZombieFAQ.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref> Zombie\'s seventh and latest series, \'\'Whatever Happened to Baron Von Shock?\'\' spawned four issues in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comicvine.com/whatever-happened-to-baron-von-shock/49-33381/ |title=Whatever Happened to Baron Von Shock? (Image comic book) \xe2\x80\x93 4 issues |publisher=Comicvine.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref>

Zombie has been an [[Vegetarianism|ethical vegetarian]] for over 30 years<ref name="sammag">{{cite web |last=Bliss |first=Karen |url=http://www.samaritanmag.com/1392/rob-zombie-animals-always-need-be-protected |title=Rob Zombie: Animals Always Need To Be Protected |publisher=SamaritanMag}}</ref> and recently{{when|date=January 2015}} turned [[vegan]] along with his wife Sheri.<ref>{{cite web|title=IAm Rob Zombie, musician and writer/director of The Lords of Salem. AMA!|url=http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/1cmd3o/iam_rob_zombie_musician_and_writerdirector_of_the/c9hwb1g|publisher=[[reddit]]}}</ref> He is a supporter of [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals|PETA]].<ref name="sammag"/>

Rob Zombie has also created a haunted attraction franchise for the Halloween season that has appeared in various cities. He announced his Great American Nightmare haunted house experience on Los Angeles for the 2013 Halloween season. From October 10 through November 2, 2013 at the Fairplex FEARplex in Pomona, CA. Zombie combined haunted house attractions \'\'Lords of Salem Total Black Out\'\', \'\'The Haunted World of El Superbeasto 3D\'\', and \'\'House of 1000 Corpses\'\' with a music festival from artists in hard rock, alternative, EDM, and more.<ref>{{cite web|title=Rob Zombie:Announces Great American Nightmare Haunted Attraction|url=http://louderthanhell.net/bands/united-states/rob-zombie/news/2013/06/17/230650/announces-great-american-nightmare-haunted-attraction/|publisher=louderthanhell.net}}</ref> For the 2014 Halloween season, Rob Zombie\'s Great American Nightmare attractions appeared in Phoenix, Arizona<ref>{{cite web|title=Rob Zombie at WestWorld|url=http://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/slideshow/rob-zombie-at-westworld-41871871/|publisher=Phoenix New Times}}</ref> and Villa Park, Illinois<ref>{{cite web|title=Rocker/filmmaker Rob Zombie goes for jugular in Villa Park haunted house|url=http://www.dailyherald.com/article/20141007/entlife/141008899/|publisher=www.dailyherald.com}}</ref>

==Artistry==

===Musical style===
[[File:Rob Zombie Performing in 2011.png|thumb|Rob Zombie performing in 2011 for the "Hell on Earth" tour with [[Slayer (band)|Slayer]].]]
Zombie\'s music has been noted for its use of [[horror film|horror and suspense elements]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.last.fm/music/Rob+Zombie/Hellbilly+Deluxe |title=Hellbilly Deluxe \xe2\x80\x93 Rob Zombie \xe2\x80\x93 Listen and discover music at |publisher=Last.fm |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maximumink.com/index.php/articles/permalink/rob_zombie/ |title=Maximum Ink music magazine of Wisconsin &#124; Artist Interviews &#124; Rob Zombie |publisher=Maximumink.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ifc.com/fix/2012/08/heavy-metal-and-horror |title=Heavy Metal and Horror \xe2\x80\x93 IFC |publisher=Ifc.com |date=2012-08-14 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> which is inspired by Zombie\'s love of horror films.<ref>{{cite web|last=Vo |first=Alex |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/comic_con_2009/news/1834259/five_favorite_films_with_rob_zombie/ |title=Five Favorite Films With Rob Zombie |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |date=2009-07-26 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie\'s music also contains elements commonly found in [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://delafont.com/music_acts/rob-zombie.htm |title=ROB ZOMBIE booking \xe2\x80\x93 Heavy Metal Music Artists \xe2\x80\x93 Corporate Event Booking Agent |publisher=Delafont.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=54316 |title=Exclusive: Rob Zombie Approached for Heavy Metal |publisher=ComingSoon.net |date=2009-04-08 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://gantdaily.com/2012/06/21/heavy-metal-musician-rob-zombie-to-produce-flyers-flick/ |title=Heavy metal musician Rob Zombie to produce Flyers flick |publisher=GantDaily.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> and [[alternative metal]] music.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/s?ie=UTF8&keywords=Rob%20Zombie&page=1&rh=n%3A67207%2Ck%3ARob%20Zombie%2Cp_n_theme_browse-bin%3A3409784011 |title=Rob Zombie \xe2\x80\x93 Alternative Metal / Hard Rock & Metal: Music |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fye.com/Icon-Front-Page_stcVVproductId131696639VVcatId455366VVviewprod.htm |title=Alternative Metal \xe2\x80\x93 Icon Rob Zombie / CD / 2011 |publisher=FYE |date=2010-05-22 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie\'s music has been described as "melding metal with industrial, hypnotic rhythms and haunting sounds" and having a "complicated beat, distinctive vocals and a killer story line".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.roughedge.com/cdreviews/z/robzombie.htm |title=Rob Zombie CD Reviews |publisher=Rough Edge |date=2012-05-20 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie\'s songs have also been known to feature quotes and samples from classic horror films.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://celebritywonder.ugo.com/html/robzombie_trivia1.html |title=Rob Zombie News and Trivias at CelebrityWonder.com |publisher=Celebritywonder.ugo.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Numerous songs on his debut album, \'\'[[Hellbilly Deluxe]]\'\', feature quotes from films such as \'\'[[The Last House on the Left (1972 film)|The Last House on the Left]]\'\',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=4172 |title=Dragula by Rob Zombie Songfacts |publisher=Songfacts.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> \'\'[[The Satanic Rites of Dracula]]\'\',<ref name="reocities.com"/> and \'\'[[Mark of the Devil]]\'\'.<ref name="rateyourmusic.com"/> It has been stated that Zombie\'s music "explore [his] fascination with psychotic noise, pummeling grooves, campy samples, and all things horrific."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tower.com/hellbilly-deluxe-rob-zombie-cd/wapi/106244019 |title=Music: Hellbilly Deluxe (CD) by Rob Zombie (Artist) |publisher=Tower.com |date=1998-08-25 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie has classified himself as a [[Heavy metal music|metal]] musician, and stated "It felt like hard rock and heavy metal had really been struggling you know, like top of the charts \xe2\x80\x93 it felt like they were being kicked to the curb for a long time. It was almost like you were doing something but you feel like nobody cares anymore so now you\xe2\x80\x99re just chuggin\xe2\x80\x99 along doing what you do and it\xe2\x80\x99s like the world had forgotten. However it\xe2\x80\x99s felt like in the last few years that\xe2\x80\x99s kind of changed and you feel it coming back."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://loudwire.com/rob-zombie-interview-band-lineup-upcoming-album-touring-more/ |title=Rob Zombie on Band Chemistry, Upcoming Album, Touring + More |publisher=Loudwire.com |date=2012-05-11 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref>

===Influences===
Zombie\'s music heavily draws influence from classic [[horror films]] and [[suspense|suspense films]]. He has listed [[Alice Cooper]], [[Kiss (band)|KISS]], [[Black Sabbath]], [[Queen (band)|Queen]], and [[Elton John]] as some of his influences growing up.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spinner.com/2010/08/19/rob-zombie-queen-elton-john/ |title=Rob Zombie Influenced by Queen and Elton John?!? |publisher=Spinner |date=2010-08-19 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> In addition, he has stated that the first record he bought was an [[Alice Cooper]] record.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rzr.online.fr/docs/zombie/alicecooper.htm |title=Alice Cooper & Rob Zombie : Influences, Interviews (Zombie land 2) |publisher=Rzr.online.fr |date=1995-10-28 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie\'s "[[Never Gonna Stop (The Red Red Kroovy)]] music video is heavily inspired by \'\'[[A Clockwork Orange (film)|A Clockwork Orange]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite web |author=Madison  |url=http://unrealitymag.com/index.php/2010/06/11/music-videos-with-clockwork-orange-references/ |title=Seven Music Videos Influenced by A Clockwork Orange |publisher=Unrealitymag.com |date=11 June 2010  |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie later revealed to [[People (magazine)|\'\'People\'\' magazine]] that while he was growing up, he was not allowed to watch films such as \'\'A Clockwork Orange\'\' or \'\'[[The Texas Chain Saw Massacre]]\'\',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,615052,00.html |title=Rob Zombie\'s TV Influence \xe2\x80\x93 Rob Zombie |work=People |date=1999-05-21 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> the latter of which heavily influenced Zombie\'s films \'\'[[House of 1000 Corpses]]\'\' and its sequel \'\'[[The Devil\'s Rejects]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|author=Tim Harden |url=http://www.texaschainsawmassacre.net/Homages/Homages.htm |title=Homages to the Texas Chain Saw Massacre |publisher=Texaschainsawmassacre.net |date= |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> Zombie\'s music videos are also inspired by horror films, with his "[[Living Dead Girl (song)|Living Dead Girl]]" music video being based upon the 1920 silent horror film \'\'[[The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hollywood-movies.yoexpert.com/hollywood-movies-general/what-is-film-s-influence-on-music-31995.html |title=What is film\'s influence on music? |publisher=Hollywood-movies.yoexpert.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref>
